name: Slava Kim
body:
![My Head](http://www.meteor.com/people/slava.jpg)

Buzzword bingo is following

***

### Tech savvy

I spend my evenings watching SICP videos, reading The Dragon Book and revisiting favourite chapters of CLRS. Two years ago I would spend my friday evening on a TopCoder round.

### Startups kid

My current gig is a YC company of 13 people. The one before was 4 guys hacker house with pool!

### Hipster technologies included

I write my code in JavaScript, know how to use MongoDB, have no experience with SQL but if I choose one it would be Postgresql!

All my webapps are written in Meteor, I might even use CoffeeScript and will definitely choose ElasticSearch as a full-text search solution. What else can I through into those apps? Redis, RethinkDB, Doozer and PhoneGap? Sounds good.

What is my favorite language? The answer should be "Lisp" but I am going with Clojure this time.

### Typical Silicon Valley kid

No college, just passion and vision, you know.

### Religious

Vim only, Emacs free. I even own books on Vim and I spent hours in the Internet arguing it is the editor *real programmers* use!

### Have my setup

MBP, Thunderbolt display, Kinesis Advantage keyboard and a convertible standing desk - this is the standard in my company!

***

## Seriously

I enjoy learning the advanced layers of Computer Science. After spending several years on Competitive Programming I finally arrived to the industry.

Right now I am actively learning about:

- SICP
- Compilers (coursera course)
- Distributed Systems (something I learn from my peers)

Today I work at [Meteor][meteor]. Before I worked at [Collections][collections].

I try to hack on different ideas on the weekends. Most of them never get implemented because of my laziness but some make it to my Github profile, mostly algorithmy things.

[meteor]: https://www.meteor.com
[collections]: https://collections.me
